alert.note: Alert for Spartanburg (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 04 at 5:58PM EST until January 07 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Nuisance flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of upstate South Carolina, including the following county, Spartanburg. * WHEN...Until 700 AM EST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Nuisance flooding of low-lying areas adjacent to streams including woodlands, farmland, parks, greenways, golf courses, and boat-access areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 548 PM EST, Lawsons Fork Creek remains above bankfull and is flooding adjacent, low-lying areas from US 221 to Goldmine Rd near the Pacolet River confluence, including portions of the Country Club of Spartanburg and the Glendale Shoals Preserve. The stream is cresting near 13.5 feet and will begin a gradual recession over the next hour. However, it will take several hours for Lawsons Fork Creek to fall back below the Action/Advisory Stage of 12.0 feet. Therefore, the Flood Advisory will remain in effect through this evening until the stream recedes back within its banks. - Some locations that may experience flooding include...low- lying areas adjacent to Lawsons Fork Creek.
info.instruction: Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
